required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating InductOs in Diaphyseal Tibia Fractures
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Randomized, Controlled, Stratified Study of InductOs in Subjects With Open Diaphyseal Tibia Fractures Treated With Reamed Locked Intramedullary Nail Fixation

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: Demonstrate a larger proportion of subjects with healed fractures among subjects treated with InductOs and reamed, locked intramedullary nailing compared to subjects treated with reamed, locked intramedullary nailing alone.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Healed Fractures

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Achieving Combined Clinical and Radiographic Endpoint (CCRE)

arm_group.description: InductOs is rhBMP-2/ACS 1.5 mg/ml implanted once at the time of definitive fracture coverage +surgical fixation
Standard of Care: Surgical fixation only

intervention.description: InductOs is rhBMP-2/ACS 1.5 mg/ml implanted once at the time of definitive fracture coverage

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with acute open tibial shaft fractures (Gustilo Type I, II, IIIA, or IIIB) who require surgical management with reamed, statically locked intramedullary nail fixation and who are at low risk for amputation.
- Subjects should be at least 18 years of age, be skeletally mature, and be able to provide written informed consent.
- Initial fracture stabilization and wound debridement should occur within 1 day after injury and DFC should occur within 14 days after injury.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Planned treatment for the fracture should not include further procedures to promote fracture healing. After 16 weeks have elapsed since DFC, unanticipated procedures to promote fracture healing are permitted as clinically indicated.
- Presence of fracture distraction > 2 mm following definitive fracture fixation.
- Presence of purulent drainage from the fracture site or evidence of active osteomyelitis.

overall_official.affiliation: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were recruited worldwide from September 2003 to July 2007.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Assessment of the fractured limb was performed 24 hours before surgical fixation. Patients were stratified by severity of fracture (using Gustilo-Anderson Classification).

group.title: rhBMP-2/ACS
group.description: InductOs (dibotermin alfa) contains 12 mg of recombinant human bone morphogenetic protein-2 (rhBMP-2) in the form of a 1.5 mg/ml solution on an absorbable collagen sponge (ACS) implanted once at the time of definitive fracture coverage + surgical fixation

group.title: Standard of Care
group.description: Standard of Care: Surgical fixation only

group.title: rhBMP-2/ACS
group.description: InductOs (dibotermin alfa) contains 12 mg of recombinant human bone morphogenetic protein-2 (rhBMP-2) in the form of a 1.5 mg/ml solution on an absorbable collagen sponge (ACS) implanted once at the time of definitive fracture coverage + surgical fixation

group.title: Standard of Care
group.description: Standard of Care: Surgical fixation only

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Healed Fractures
outcome.description: Patients categorized by investigator as healed, not healed, no outcome (using pre-specified criteria). Healed: no tenderness at fracture site or pain with weight bearing, presence of bridging callus or disappearance of fracture lines, no hardware failure, no secondary intervention to promote fracture healing. Not healed: diagnosis of delayed union or nonunion, hardware failure, secondary intervention procedure for fracture healing recommended or performed, or conduct of procedure that may interfere with fracture healing. No outcome: subjects who did not achieve either healed or not healed.

group.title: rhBMP-2/ACS
group.description: InductOs (dibotermin alfa) contains 12 mg of recombinant human bone morphogenetic protein-2 (rhBMP-2) in the form of a 1.5 mg/ml solution on an absorbable collagen sponge (ACS) implanted once at the time of definitive fracture coverage + surgical fixation

group.title: Standard of Care
group.description: Standard of Care: Surgical fixation only

measure.title: Number of Patients With Healed Fractures
measure.description: Patients categorized by investigator as healed, not healed, no outcome (using pre-specified criteria). Healed: no tenderness at fracture site or pain with weight bearing, presence of bridging callus or disappearance of fracture lines, no hardware failure, no secondary intervention to promote fracture healing. Not healed: diagnosis of delayed union or nonunion, hardware failure, secondary intervention procedure for fracture healing recommended or performed, or conduct of procedure that may interfere with fracture healing. No outcome: subjects who did not achieve either healed or not healed.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of Healed vs Not healed/No outcome for week 13.
Comparison of Healed vs Not healed/No outcome for week 20.

outcome.title: Number of Patients Achieving Combined Clinical and Radiographic Endpoint (CCRE)
outcome.description: Patients categorized as Success or Failure of CCRE. Success defined as a fracture judged to be both clinically healed by clinical investigator, “healed” (see primary outcome), and radiographically united by independent, blinded radiology panel, “united.” Patients deemed “not healed” or “not united” were assessed as failures.

event.sub_title: Healing abnormal: bleeding at wound site

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PIs agreed to allow the sponsor 60 days to review and require changes to presentations or publications but only to protect confidential information and intellectual property, and for the sponsor to file a patent application, as applicable. The PIs also agreed for data to be presented first as a joint, multi-center publication.
